activities.loc: Law Enforcement Center - Lower Level Hearing Room - LC300

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William N Silva

records.addlTxt: State's NOI to Introduce Certified Medical Records
State's NOI to Intro Deft's Statements
Preliminary hearing on November 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:. No contact with the victim A.M. (including but not limited to 3rd party, email, social media, person, property, residence or family).  Defendant is to be placed on HOUSE ARREST with GPS monitoring through Racine County Alternatives Program (717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine). Defendant MAY ONLY BE RELEASED to the supervision of RCAP.  Exceptions to house arrest are court, attorney and defendant's medical appointments. Note: $120 advance fee for installment of the GPS must be paid prior to the release from jail. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

8:34 AM Defendant William N Silva in court, in custody. Atty Erin Preston appeared on behalf of the defendant.  Attorney Patricia J Hanson in court for William N Silva. Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski.  State is in Chapter 950 compliance.  This was put on the Br. 2 calendar due to Br. 10 being at the Judicial Conference. The court was informed that the defendant refused to come to court yesterday.  The court did issue an order for the defendant to be brought to court by reasonable means necessary today.  The defendant is complying today.   The State has filed a bond motion.  State makes further argument.  The victims father would like to speak.  Defense does not believe the father is a victim in the case.  BTC: This is a party to and a representative for the victim and the court will allow him to speak per Marcy's Law.  Father of the victim makes statement.  Defense makes argument. Defense also informs the court that the defendant did not know he had court yesterday and never refused to come.  BTC: Bond Modification granted to $10,000 cash, same conditions, reiterating No contact with the victim (including but not limited to 3rd party, email, social media, person, property, residence or family).  adding Defendant is to be placed on HOUSE ARREST with GPS monitoring through Racine County Alternatives Program (717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine). Defendant MAY ONLY BE RELEASED to the supervision of RCAP.  Exceptions to house arrest are court, attorney and defendant's medical appointments. Note: $120 advance fee for installment of the GPS must be paid prior to the release from jail. 

State asks the court to enter an order for No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family) from the confines of RCJ.  BTC: Motion granted, State will file an order.
for the Sheriff's Dept. to bring defendant to court from RCJ
for defendant to be brought to court from RCJ

10:12 AM Defendant William N Silva not in court.  Atty Erin Preston appears on behalf of the deft.  Prosecuting attorney John M Wagner in court for the State of Wisconsin. Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski.  The State files a denovo review.  The initial appearance was yesterday, bond was stayed by Judge Nielsen yesterday.  The defendant refuses to appear from RCJ.  The State requests record of the refusal and to argue bond today without the deft. present or to set over for tomorrow.  BTC: The court will not have a bond review without the defendant present.  Defense is concerned about this practice.  BTC: Matter adjourned to tomorrow.  If possible defendant should be appointed counsel by SPD.  Stay of bond is still in effect.  Court will sign an order for the deputies to bring the defendant to court by reasonable means.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Bail/bond hearing on November 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Bail/bond hearing on November 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No contact with the victim A.M. (person, property, residence or family).

1:45 PM Defendant William N Silva appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney McKenna Marie Quinter appeared by video for William N Silva.  Prosecuting attorney Brian Van Schyndel appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Initial appearance on October 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
